subject: class isolation and class order for testing
msgSnippet: Hello JUnit community, 1) Do I break the basic JUnit rule of class isolation if I do NOT isolate a class from its collaborators that have already been tested?
messageBody:
Hello JUnit community,

1)
Do I break the basic JUnit rule of class isolation if I do NOT isolate
a class from its collaborators that have already been tested?

So do I still need mock/stub/fake objects for tested dependant classes
in any case?

2)
Is there any strategy/method in what order you can test classes for an
existing project?

Actually I explored the class dependencies of my project and I started
with the "leaf-classes" (meaning those that have no
dependencies/collaborators at all...). Then I took those classes that
have no collaborators at all or only collaborators that were tested in
one of our previous test runs and so on...

Many thanks,
Csaba
